item.title: Why ECS
item.description: I, like many programmers often do, first began experimenting with programming through games. They can be quite simple to write, and provide a self contained, easily testable, tangible, and fun way to learn programming. To this day, the first thing I will try to build when learning a new UI framework or platform is to build a simple clicker “game”. Though highly contrived, it exercises maintaining and updating state, programmatically updating the view, and interfacing with the event system—all common requirements for building a UI program.
